column4: Ok, I am a newbie with nvidia cards..I am given the choice to install version 173 or 177, what should I choose?
Ive got a nVidia Corporation GeForce 6150SE
I'm pretty sure they both support that card... I'd go with the older one though, as that is a pretty dated card.
Do you think I will have better performance using the older driver?
It shouldn't matter either way.... I'd stick to the older one to be on the safe side though.
ok how often does nvidia drivers get out for linux?
You won't need to update.... for a LONG time
= they does not release very often :(
= they're dropping support slowly with new drivers
:( I knew I should have bought an aticard
Well, ancient in today's terms =P I have a 6800...
that would explain the price.. you dont happen to know if I can have both an integrated card and a regular card and only using the latter?
Yup, just disable the internal video from the bios, you should be fine. if you plan on upgrading, I'd go for an 8800 GT, cheap, and only one PCIe 2.0 x16 slot
Aha I tought you meant they were dropping support slowly for all cards :)
Ohhh, no no no... xD they dropped 3D support for GeForce 4000's... 6's are fine for now though
ok thanks! will check 8800b GT out!
